"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5400d7f36368722d6f5b0100#post_5400d7f36368722d6f5b0100

I have a strong feeling that Miiverse doesn't read their reports.

I once got a ban for posting a QR code of my Tomodachi Mii. Apparently, it was "sharing personal information" even though I had removed my real name from the Mii.

Ridiculous indeed. 


"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5400d7d16368725bbed50000#post_5400d7d16368725bbed50000

I wish I was.

Meanwhile, twelve year olds post their Kik information in the YT community and it takes the admins a few hours to take the post down.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5400d78063687206aabf0000#post_5400d78063687206aabf0000
That's nothing; last night I had a argument with some dude that thought that cause something is on the internet that is must be true and tried to explain to him that what he was describing as he said that was 100% true and had without a doubt happened was not physically possible for to have happened and trying to explain to him that just cause you see something "programming" wise on the movie the Matrix doesn't mean that reality works that way.  I had about a hour long argument trying to explain to him the limitations of physical media and he kept going "well there's no the person who made this claim would lie" and tried to get it through his thick ass skull that people lie and that if something someone claims to have had happened is not physically possible then chances they're lying.

It's made me think, how many websites have decent admins? Derpibooru might be the only website that I frequent that have competent overlords.
